activities.loc: Monroe County Justice Center - Branch II

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonel Ramos-Hernandez

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on November 29, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Clerk mails defendant his bond 10/19/22 to new address 616 Chetooka Circle Cashton, WI. 54619

Defendant Leonel Ramos-Hernandez appeared by phone.  Attorney Tempelis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Susan Rascon appears via zoom video. Defendant makes statements regarding getting an attorney. Defendant states that he is trying to contact public defender. Clerk will mail bond to defendant to be signed and returned by 11/29/22. warrant is quashed.

Defendant Leonel Ramos-Hernandez appeared by video.  Attorney Tempelis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Fred Svensson appears by zoom video and was sworn in by judge. Court orders $500 signature bond with conditions to be signed by 9/6/22. Court instructs defendant to contact public defenders office and to contact the clerk of courts regarding address change. Court adjourns.
